meanings.definition: Official documents, especially those showing ownership or identity.
meanings.sent1: I keep all my important papers in a folder.
meanings.sent2: She read about the news in the papers every morning.
meanings.sent3: The papers proving I'm a superhero got mixed up with my grocery list!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a stack of freshly printed papers.
meanings.sent5: The papers with the golden seal were the key to his inheritance.

meanings.sent1: The local papers reported on the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed reading the sports section of the papers.
meanings.sent3: The papers were so entertaining, they made him forget about his chores.
meanings.sent4: The words in the papers danced off the page and into her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The papers on the stand caught her eye with their bold headlines.

meanings.sent1: She worked hard on her history papers for school.
meanings.sent2: His favorite part of English class was writing papers.
meanings.sent3: The papers he wrote were so good, they made his teacher smile.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a blank sheet of paper waiting for inspiration to strike.
meanings.sent5: The papers on the desk held the secrets of his creativity.

meanings.definition: Thin sheets of material used for writing or printing.
meanings.sent1: The artist used special papers for her watercolor paintings.
meanings.sent2: He scribbled notes on small pieces of paper.
meanings.sent3: The papers fluttered in the wind like colorful butterflies.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were scattered like confetti made of tiny papers.
meanings.sent5: The papers rustled softly as she turned the pages of her sketchbook.
